io.robusta.rra.security.implementation

Class CodecImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.robusta.rra.security.implementation.CodecImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Codec

    public class CodecImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements Codec
    This class makes some Base64 and MD5 encoding/decoding
    Thanx to SupInfo Labs, Robert Harder and M.Duchrow
    Author:
    Nicolas Zozol for Robusta Web ToolKit & Edupassion.com - nzozol@robustaweb.com
    See Also:
    SHA-1 Java : http://www.anyexample.com/programming/java/java_simple_class_to_compute_sha_1_hash.xml //

      java.lang.String getPassword(java.lang.String b64String)
      When you decode dfskdjflk==, you retrieve (kslater:mypassword) This function retrieve mypassword, or throw a CodecException if the ':' doesn't exist
      java.lang.String getUsername(java.lang.String b64String)
      When you decode dfskdjflk==, you retrieve (kslater:mypassword) This function retrieve mypassword, or throw a CodecException if the ':' doesn't exist

    • Method Detail

      • encodeBase64

        public java.lang.String encodeBase64(java.lang.String toEncode)
        Description copied from interface: Codec
        Encode a Base64 string. Usually, the string to encode looks is "user:password" For newbbes, please note that Base64 does not encrypt but allows to submit for exemple a password containint spaces or special caracters through the web
        Specified by:
        encodeBase64 in interface Codec
        Parameters:
        toEncode -
        Returns:
        the Base64 string
        See Also:
        Codec.encodeBase64(String)

      • encodeMD5

        public java.lang.String encodeMD5(java.lang.String toEncode)
        Description copied from interface: Codec
        Create a MD5 hash. Be aware that MD5 alone is not a truly safe method to protect your users password. See for exemple John the Ripper software.
        Specified by:
        encodeMD5 in interface Codec
        Parameters:
        toEncode - String to hash
        Returns:
        the md5 encoded String

      • getUsername

        public java.lang.String getUsername(java.lang.String b64String)
                             throws CodecException
        When you decode dfskdjflk==, you retrieve (kslater:mypassword) This function retrieve mypassword, or throw a CodecException if the ':' doesn't exist
        Specified by:
        getUsername in interface Codec
        Parameters:
        b64String -
        Returns:
        the password of the encoded pattern
        Throws:
        CodecException - if no username can be found in the enocoded string
        See Also:
        Codec.encodeBase64(String)
